channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Who Even Is a Criminal Now?
item.description: WIRED loves a rogue. Except rogues ruined the internet. Is there any salvaging the rebellious spirit without destroying everything?

item.title: For Tech Whistleblowers, There’s Safety in Numbers
item.description: Amber Scorah and Psst are building a “digital safe” to help people shine a light on the bad things their bosses are doing, without getting found out.

item.title: Uber eyes B2B logistics push in India through state-backed open commerce network
item.description: Uber is entering India’s growing B2B logistics market by extending its partnership with the Indian government-backed nonprofit that aims to break the ...

item.title: VUZ gets $12M for its immersive video experiences across emerging markets and the U.S.
item.description: VUZ, a startup known for offering immersive video experiences from red carpets and football stadiums, has raised $12 million as it doubles down on its...

item.title: Deel wants Rippling to hand over any agreements involving paying the alleged spy
item.description: Deel has lobbed a new volley in the ongoing legal battle with rival HR tech startup Rippling. Deel filed a motion, containing a series of letters, ask...

item.title: How to Win Followers and Scamfluence People
item.description: Format Boy makes a living teaching Yahoo Boys, notorious West African scammers, how to use AI and deepfake technology to ensnare their next victims.

item.title: Bluesky Is Plotting a Total Takeover of the Social Internet
item.description: All the lefties fled to Bluesky following Elon Musk’s Twitter takeover. But CEO Jay Graber says the app is for everyone—and could revolutionize how pe...

item.title: We 3D-Printed Luigi Mangione’s Ghost Gun. It Was Entirely Legal
item.description: In the wake of Luigi Mangione’s alleged killing of a health care CEO with a partially 3D-printed pistol, we built the exact same weapon ourselves—and ...

item.title: Grok says it’s ‘skeptical’ about Holocaust death toll, then blames ‘programming error’
item.description: Grok, the AI-powered chatbot created by xAI and widely deployed across its new corporate sibling X, wasn’t just obsessed with white genocide this week...

item.title: Crypto elite increasingly worried about their personal safety
item.description: Cryptocurrency executives and other investors with significant wealth from crypto holdings are getting more serious about personal security, according...
